column5: Last time we took off from Graveyard Lake next to the Pickle Lake airport. It was interesting.... I don't recall the drive from Thunder Bay to Pickle Lake being bad at all. Departing from Mawley is interesting. Think I'd still rather leave from Pickle Lake or Armstrong.
What are you thinking????!!!! Never agree to flyout of a lake called “Graveyard”!!!!!

not if there's fog or forest fire smoke between Pickle/Armstrong and Mawley. a few years ago the only option for us was to fly into Mawley as the smoke from all the forest fires essentially blotted out Pickle Lake. Mawley is at least a viable option in that situation. PLO has an LUP on Mawley - dock and small cabin - that enables them to use it as a base of operation. phish

I think it's good to know that this alternative exists. The driving distance is the reason I would prefer the other locations. If I had to drive to somewhere like Mawley to get into the camp, I would not hesitate at all!
Thxs. I just travel on 160 miles (320 in/out) in Quebec...that was enough for this year. FT
Fishermen are dying to get into Graveyard.

Would like to talk with Anyone who has been in the Past 2 weeks to North Caribou Lake with (Former, Deceasd Owner Pete Johnson) Pickle Lake Outposts? This is Urgent for my group as we are scheduled for a trip there next week and Need Information Larry Schroeder
Can you contact the new owner if it's urgent?
It’s probably too obvious to call your outfitter. Assiuming you have been trying??? Maybe call local chamber of commerce, local baitshop etc maybe????Good Luck
Have taken care of the problem. Just wanted to talk to the past people who fished there this year to see how the camp is!
Always heard that is a great lake with big pike. Kudos to you driving all the way to the end of civilization in Pickle Lake

How is the fishing in the pickle lake area? When i was really young we went to Pashkokogan(?) lake and i think it might be in that area???? the fishing was really good from what i remember as a 12 year old? haha

Pickle Lake the village is just the beginning of my adventures up there. Up the gravel road many miles-up a big river many miles--portage over to a walleye factory----PORK AND BEANER HERE----Never ever see another fisherman or fisher woman....Just the way I like it...PORK AND BEANER......

Lenray - glad you're still hanging out on this board. For our trip to N Caribou last year we took a van up the Windigo Lake Road to Mawley lake where we flew out to N Caribou. the per mile trip cost via a van is MUCH less than the per mile cost for an otter. took more than a half hour out of the flying time. anyway - the road was like an interstate highway - smooth and some dust but not bad - and the outfitter is considering building an outpost cabin on Mawley and we want to be first there - no "pork and beans" for us except with a grilled pork tenderloin!! stay heathy and active! phish
phish, will we be on gravel roads this year? I hate dust but can prepare to handle. FT

the road north of Pickle Lake is now paved to about where it crosses the Otoskwin River then gravel past that. we are scheduled to fly out of Pickle Lake - roads are totally paved to here. however, in the past, the outfitter has changed the floatplane departure/arrival plans to leave/arrive at Mawley Lake - they have used a van to get us from Pickle Lake to Mawley so there should be no need for us to drive past Pickle Lake. flying from Mawley to North Caribou Lake - instead of flying from Pickle lake - cuts the flight time more than in half and minimizes potential weather (or smoke!) issues. you can find Mawley Lake on Google Maps at 52°20'12.3"N 90°45'49.4"W and see how much closer it is to N Caribou. phish
